Career_guru open navigation drawer close navigation drawer The subjects covered in a diploma in mechanical engineering program typically include a combination of core and elective topics, providing students with a strong foundation in both theoretical and practical aspects of the field.\nSome of the common subjects found in the curriculum of a diploma in mechanical engineering are:\nEngineering Mathematics,Engineering Physics,Engineering Chemistry,Environmental Studies,Engineering Mechanics,Electrical Technology,Computer Fundamentals,Thermodynamics,Fluid Mechanics,Manufacturing Processes,Machine Design,Control Systems,CAD/CAM,Project Management,Hydraulics,Applied Physics,Applied Chemistry,Strength of Materials,Power Plant Engineering,Non-Conventional Energy Resources,Metal Casting Science and Engineering."
There are two sub-branches in the Science stream, divided based on the third subject you study:\n
Medical: This branch includes Physics, Chemistry, Biology, and English, along with an optional subject.\n
Non-Medical: This branch includes Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics, along with an optional subject.
The science stream is a popular choice for students who are interested in pursuing careers in fields such as medicine, research, or technology.The subjects in the science stream in class 11 include Physics, Chemistry, Biology, Mathematics, and Computer Science Physics and Chemistry are common to both the Non-medical and Medical stream, while Mathematics is taken by students who wish to pursue careers in engineering, architecture, aeronautics, etc. Biology is chosen if one wants to start a career in the medical field The science stream offers an enticing path of exploration and discovery, unveiling the intricacies of the natural world and the human body. It fuels curiosity, challenges the intellect, and inspires innovation. By pursuing the science stream, students embark on a thrilling adventure where they become detectives, unraveling the mysteries of atoms, life, and the cosmosAfter completing the science stream, students can pursue various career paths such as engineering, medicine, research and development, data analysis, and scientific writing
